abstract: Pimco's RealRetirement target-date funds allow managers some hedge fund-like leeway, and the company thinks you should save 20 percent of your income.
snippet: Pimco's RealRetirement target-date funds allow managers some hedge fund-like leeway, and the company thinks you should save 20 percent of your income.
lead_paragraph: In this weekend's Your Money column, I look at Pimco's fledgling effort to break into the target-date fund segment of the mutual funds industry, an area dominated by Vanguard, Fidelity and T. Rowe Price, which sell these funds to administrators of 401(k) and similar workplace retirement plans.

headline.main: Pimco, Yoda and Some Big Retirement Savings Questions
